events.message: The applicant submitted the personal loan application intended for covering upcoming medical expenses and consolidating existing debt.
Loan application was categorized as a personal loan as it involved medical and debt consolidation purposes, matching criteria accurately.
A loan officer, specializing in personal loans, was assigned to handle the application and guide the applicant through the next steps.
The loan officer performed an initial review of the documents provided in the application to verify completeness and basic eligibility.
Additional documents such as recent medical bills, proof of income, and identification were requested to better assess the applicant's needs.
Applicant submitted all requested documentation including updated medical records and income statements for further processing.
The applicant's credit history was reviewed and the credit score was evaluated to determine the likelihood of loan repayment.
A detailed risk assessment was conducted considering debt levels and medical expenses to finalize the applicant's risk profile.
Based on risk evaluation, a loan offer with favorable interest rates and repayment terms was presented to the applicant.
The applicant provided positive feedback and requested some clarifications about the payment schedule before acceptance.
The application was escalated to senior management to approve modifications to the repayment schedule requested by the applicant.
After review of requested changes, the personal loan was approved with adjusted repayment terms to support the applicant's circumstances.
The approved loan amount was disbursed to the applicant's bank account, enabling them to proceed with medical payments and debt consolidation.
A follow-up call was conducted to ensure that the applicant is satisfied with the loan terms and to provide assistance if needed.
The loan application process was officially closed after all funding and follow-up activities were successfully completed.
